title.rendered: Brutal Cyclist Crash into Car During Downhill Race

content.rendered: The Guardman’s Pass Tour of Utah recently took place this past summer and someone captured footage of this particularly rough corner and a crash that took place there. A number of team cars are traveling with the cyclists but as they’re all downshifting to proceed with the hill one cyclist doesn’t cut their speed quickly enough before the curve and winds up T-Boning a car and crumpling into the pavement! It’s a rough crash!

title.rendered: The Police Car of the Future

content.rendered: Back from CES 2013 we’re taking another look at this future police car. It’s a beautiful and beefed up Dodge Charger complete with enormous touch screens all over the dashboard connected to a PC in the trunk. There’s also a rugged keyboard set up so now more fumbling with a giant, bulky laptop. Even the backseat is more comfortable for those unfortunate enough to get arrested – they’ve got molds in the seats designed to make room for individuals that are handcuffed.

title.rendered: Dodge Ram Bends in Half During Pull Contest and Still Wins the Contest!

content.rendered:
The next time somebody tries to tell you that Dodge doesn’t make a dependable truck just show them this video and drop the mic.

During the pull competition at the Big Lick event this past summer a Dodge Ram loaded down with so much weight in the front and in the bed took on a massive contender when it immediately bent in half! We’ve never seen a truck almost snap like a twig before. Even though it looked down for the count they were quickly able to bend it back into place where it competed again and turned even more heads by winning flat out!

title.rendered: This Crane Tragedy is One of the Scariest Things You’ll See All Day

content.rendered: Over in the Netherlands, in the Alphen aan den Rijn specifically, a crew was working on constructing a bridge when this horrible accident occurred. The crew was using a barge and two enormous cranes to help lift and place a large section of bridge when the weight to counter weight ratio must have been mistaken. The cranes wind up collapsing after listing the barge entirely too heavily. Early reports don’t indicate any deaths as a result but there are at least 20 injured.

title.rendered: The Weirdest Bridge in the World is Over 100 Years Old

content.rendered: This is the Newport Transporter Bridge. It’s a local attraction in Wales where it was built over 100 years ago. It’s a unique and strange type of bridge that’s no longer constructed these days. However, 100 years ago when Wales needed a bridge over this river they couldn’t construct a typical bridge of the time because of the space required to make something big enough for large ships to pass under. They also couldn’t create a typical ferry since the water depth changes so dramatically up and down all day long!

title.rendered: The Best Rage Fail You’ll See All Day!

content.rendered:
A cyclist over in England was wearing a few cameras when a car passed him too closely. He proceeded to chase down the driver to tell him (rather politely at first) that he should be more careful. The driver of the vehicle wasn’t having any of it. He starts cursing and screaming at the cyclist. The guy in the car gets to into his road rage that he loses his ability to speak actual insults and curses!

When the cyclist starts the leave the man gets out to chase him down. He tries to kick the cyclist but winds up tripping and falling end over end! We could watch this guy lose his call and take a tumble all day long!

title.rendered: The Scariest Bridge in the United States

content.rendered:
The Chesapeake Bay bridge is widely considered the single scariest bridge in America. It’s not necessarily the most dangerous but it terrifies most motorists, especially if they have a fear of heights or they get claustrophobic when on a narrow bridge.

The bridge itself can get around 200 feet high in certain parts and is roughly 4 miles long across the bay itself. The drive is so daunting for certain commuters that one man has even started a booming business that drives people, in their cars, over the bridge. He keeps the conversation casual and light and acts almost like a therapist of sorts for people who begin to feel panic attacks mid trip!

title.rendered: When This Guy in the Ferrari Starts Getting a Ticket You Won’t Believe What He Tries to Do!

content.rendered:
Someone captured this footage while walking around New York and stumbling upon a cop writing a parking ticket for a Ferrari 458 Spider. Thinking it might make for a decent video he starts filming. It turns out the car was parked inside the designated valet area for a hotel and while it’s unclear as to why the ticket was being issued in the first place the owner of the Ferrari approached as the cop was writing the ticket. The owner complains briefly and tries to refuse the ticket (Mistake #1) while getting in his car and starting it up.

Then, as you can make out in the video, as the guy tries to drive away he actually runs over the cop’s foot (Incredibly Huge Mistake #2)! That’s technically assault right there so the cop drags his spoiled ass out the window and gets set to arrest him. Then his girlfriend, Stephanie Pratt from the MTV show The Hills is left to drive him while he gets arrested.

As an added bonus he shows off his Polaris Slingshot, a unique Three-Wheel-Motorcycle!

title.rendered: You Won’t Believe What Happens to a Parked Ferrari

content.rendered:
Super car owners, like the owner of this Ferrari have all the reason in the world to be concerned about where they leave their car unattended. Strangers and pedestrians tend to notice things like a Ferrari and can’t help but stop to admire. However this owner decided to keep some cameras rolling to catch those passing by in action.

Many people wind up stopping to take selfies and that’s all well and good (especially if most look like the cute girl who stops her jog the second the car catches her attention) but those kids need to learn to not touch things that aren’t their’s! Don’t even get us started on what we’d do to that guy who spits no the windshield!

title.rendered: Biker Asks a Bike Cop to Race and He Agrees!

content.rendered:
This guy pulled up to a stop light and started chatting with the bike officer next to him. They compare bikes and talk about the weather when the biker asks the cop if he wants to race. The cop warns the biker that he’s got a turbo but that’s not scaring him. They take off and we won’t spoil the results but then the cop winds up getting fired for the stunt!

He’s since been reinstated but that’s one damn cool cop if you ask us!

title.rendered: Watch How Hackers Can Take Over Control of a Smart Car

content.rendered:
Wired magazine hired a few hackers to test an exploit that you might have recently heard about regarding Smart Cars. By hacking into the electronics that govern the entertainment systems of this Jeep Cherokee they can then work their way into the core of the entire computer controlling the car itself. If you watch you’ll see the steering wheel take on a life of its own. Hackers can even cut off brakes and mess with all the electronics.

A number of recalls are currently in effect to help work around this potentially hazardous oversight.

title.rendered: This is What Happens when a Train Collides with a Limo

content.rendered: From New Paris, Indiana comes this footage of a limo stranded on train tracks meeting the ultimate fate. The limousine was carrying around kids for a 16th birthday party but wound up straddling the tracks when it bottomed out. No one was injured and the train pushed the limo down the tracks for another minute while it decelerated.

title.rendered: Lamborghini’s Paint Job Transforms Into Captain America

content.rendered:
There’s no better a canvas for an artist than a Lamborghini Gallardo. The cars themselves already look pristine and amazing but when you see what this Lambo’s paint job can turn into with a just some water you’ll be blown away!

A graffiti artist from German named Rene Turrek used temperature sensitive color changing paint to make this Italian bull look like the most American car that’s ever existed! Water hitting the back end reveals the stars and stripes while the hood gives way to the image of the first Avenger, Captain America himself!

title.rendered: Guy Gets Tasered Trying to Put Fake Poop on a Lamborghini

content.rendered: These two guys were driving along when they claim some guy in a Lamborghini cut them off, shot them the bird and was generally a huge jerk. So they followed him to where he was shopping and decided to prank him in retaliation by placing fake poop on the windshield. When the guy came out one man filmed from the safety of their car while the other pretended to be putting his shorts back on as if he had just finished the act. The driver of the Lambo wasn’t having it though. He winds up pulling out a taser (maybe he carries it for protection when he’s cruising in his Lambo?) and puts the fake pooper down. His friend jumps out of the car immediately and loses his cool trying to calm the old man down but the damage is done!

title.rendered: Lexus LFA Opens Up on Highway and Gets Busted After Hitting 165 MPH

content.rendered:
If you own a supercar like, lets say, the Lexus LFA then the temptation to take her out on open roads and let it go with everything its got is entirely too great! That’s exactly what these guys did. They set up cameras all over and found what they thought was a nice clear stretch of road to get on it. They even bring their 552 HP beast up to top out at 168 MPH!

Sadly, they wind up gunning it past a cop who catches them slowing down but still at 114 MPH! If you listen to the cop talking to the driver he even jokes about the cameras so at least the guy had a sense of humor!

title.rendered: Chevy Trashes Ford in Their New Commercial

content.rendered:
Chevy has come out with a new ad that takes its fair share of jabs at the F-150. They put a few guys into a room with two cages: one made of steel and one made of aluminum and let them test which was stronger. Then they released a giant grizzly bear into the room and watched which cage they immediately ran to.

Just further proof that the steel Silverado will always prove stronger than the F-150!

title.rendered: Fox and Friends Fail Manhood Test of Changing a Tire

content.rendered:
A retired Navy SEAL wrote a book that describes a slow death of manhood that’s taking over the country as people are raised up and obsessed with their phones, tables and computers. He came on Fox and Friends to promote his book as demonstrate some of the more “manly” things that people should know how to do. Everything with the segment was going along well until the hosts demonstrated how to change a tire….

The two guys trying to change the tire pretty much stumble upon every mistake you can possibly make when changing a tire: they remove the lug nuts entirely before lifting car, they push on the car while it’s on the jack and they even try to remove the tire before all the nuts have been removed!

title.rendered: Cringe Worthy Camaro Burnout Crash

content.rendered: The driver of this gorgeous 1975 Chevy Camaro noticed someone on the side of the road with a camera and decided he’d try giving him a show. He starts a burnout and gets the camera man’s attention. However, as he begins to pull away he loses control and steers right into a light pole. Poor Camaro.

title.rendered: Russian Truckers Fight Back Against Highway Bandits

content.rendered: We all know Russian roads can be scary places where people try to take advantage of each other all the time (hence all the dash cams that get used as evidence to protect people) but it still takes a whole community to protect each other! This trucker stopped to change a wheel when some bandits (Highwaymen like the bandits of old) started strong arming him for money to pass through what they called their own territory. He then gets on the CB and rounds up a number of other truckers who come to his aid. Together they fight off the bandits and roll their car off the road! Well fought truckers!

title.rendered: Is This Chrome Wrapped McLaren too Chromed?

content.rendered: Chroming out a custom ride, especially something like this Mercedes SLR McLaren, can either add a touch of class or a smear of trash. We’ve seen some pretty bad chrome jobs but we’re actually pretty partial to this one. It’s also fitted out with carbon side air intakes and Brabus wheels.
